intro: Tococa subglabrata, commonly known as the Amazonian coffee plant, is a species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other coffee and shrub species. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, known as a drupe, contains a single seed used for caffeine extraction. Due to its unique properties, it is of interest in both botanical research and sustainable agriculture.
